snippet: On a subdued anniversary of the terrorist attacks, the names of the dead were intoned by friends and relatives for almost four hours where the towers fell 11 years ago.
abstract: Faces on the stage at the 11th anniversary ceremony for the victims of the September 11 attacks are almost exclusively those of the 200 readers listing the dead, one name at a time; politicians did attend, but none spoke, under rules that Mayor Michael R Bloomberg imposed for a subdued 2012 ceremony.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Shanksville, Pa., and Washington, and Ashley Parker from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: On a subdued anniversary of the terrorist attacks, the names of the dead were intoned by friends and relatives for almost four hours where the towers fell 11 years ago.

headline.seo: Readers at Ground Zero Keep Alive Memories of the Lost
headline.main: At Ground Zero, Readers Offer Plain-Spoken Tributes to Those Lost
headline.print_headline: At Ground Zero, Readers Offer Plain-Spoken Tributes to Those Lost
